title: cmd/gc: len(x) where x contains function calls should not be constant
body:
package main

var s [][10]int
const n = len(s[0])        // legal
const m = len(s[len(s)-1]) // illegal according to spec - contains a (built-in) function
call, but a call nevertheless

spec: "The expressions len(s) and cap(s) are constants if the type of s is an array
or pointer to an array and the expression s does not contain channel receives or
function calls; in this case s is not evaluated. Otherwise, invocations of len and cap
are not constant and s is evaluated." (
http://tip.golang.org/ref/spec#Length_and_capacity )
